items.title: Grab deal shines light on Cambodia
items.author: Jofie Yordan
items.summary:
- Grab acquires Cambodian company Nham24, enhancing its presence in Cambodia's tech scene.
- This acquisition signals Grab's intent to dominate the Cambodian market, which has significant growth potential.
- The deal underscores the shift in focus towards Cambodia as an emerging market within Southeast Asia's digital economy.

items.title: Series SEA: Who’s investing in the region’s education startups?
items.summary:
- Investors most active in Southeast Asia’s education scene are listed based on the number of deals in the past two years.
- Only firms that have invested in three or more companies in the region during this period are featured.
- The data is ongoing; accuracy can be improved with feedback via research@techinasia.com.
- For more investor funding data, see [here](https://www.techinasia.com/tag/investor-funding-lists).

items.title: Cloudflare launches new tool to block AI web scrapers
items.summary:
- Cloudflare has launched AI Labyrinth, a new tool for blocking web-crawling bots that scrape data for AI training without permission.
- Unlike traditional methods, AI Labyrinth employs AI-generated decoy pages to mislead these bots.
- The tool functions as a “next-generation honeypot,” trapping AI crawlers in loops of fake content.
- Website administrators can enable AI Labyrinth from the Bot Management section of their Cloudflare dashboard.
- Future developments will include creating interconnected networks of fake URLs to enhance the tool's effectiveness against advanced bot strategies.

items.title: Indian tech incubator invests $3.6m seed capital in 136 startups
items.author: Arvind Kumar
items.summary:
- Software Technology Parks of India (STPI) invested 30.87 crore rupee (US$3.59 million) in 136 startups as of Mar. 21.
- STPI also provided 3.57 crore rupee (US$415,162) in stipends to 359 startups.
- 134 startups backed by STPI have secured 286 crore rupee (US$33.26 million) in external funding.
- Women entrepreneurs lead 44% of STPI’s portfolio startups, many from Tier-II and Tier-III cities.
- STPI operates 13+ centers of excellence focusing on healthtech, IoT, and agritech.
- Aligns with commerce minister Piyush Goyal’s goal of creating 5,000 unicorns in India.

items.title: OpenAI, Meta eye AI partnership with Reliance Industries
items.summary:
- OpenAI and Meta are exploring partnerships with Reliance Industries.
- Discussions include product distribution via Reliance's business units, like Jio.
- The partnerships aim to offer AI solutions, although specifics remain unclear.
- OpenAI and Meta's collaboration may help them engage with Indian officials and consumers.

items.title: Indian, Japanese spacetech startups partner for orbital tech
items.summary:
- Japan-based Astroscale partners with Indian startups Digantara and Bellatrix Aerospace for orbital technology.
- This partnership aims to bid for orbital services contracts in India, leveraging the country's space capabilities.
- Astroscale offers on-orbit servicing solutions, while Digantara focuses on space debris detection and Bellatrix develops eco-friendly satellite propulsion systems.
- The collaboration follows a previous partnership in December 2024 between InspeCity and Japan's Orbital Lasers on space debris removal.

items.title: Norwegian central bank invests $8.1m in Nazara
items.summary:
- Norges Bank invests $8.11 million in Nazara Technologies, acquiring 719,000 shares at ₹969.65 each.
- This is Norges Bank's first investment in Nazara.
- Nazara's stock performance has been mixed since its debut in March 2021, currently down 4.5% year-to-date but up 5.01% over the last month.
- The company reported a 53.5% drop in net profit in Q3 FY25 but a 66.8% increase in operating revenue.
- Nazara continues to expand through acquisitions, recently increasing its stake in Absolute Sports to 100%.

items.title: Capital SEA: Southeast Asia’s funding landscape
items.summary:
- The article explores recent trends in Southeast Asia's funding landscape, analyzing investor activity and notable funding rounds.
- It comprises two main sections: a weekly update showcasing recent investors and companies, and a macro trends section that illustrates funding distribution across regions and sectors.
- Notable contributors to the content include infographics by Yeo Cheng Yong and editing by Terence Lee.

items.title: US watchdog investigates nine Chinese firms for rule evasion
items.summary:
- The FCC is investigating nine Chinese companies for potentially evading US restrictions, including Huawei and ZTE.
- Other firms under investigation are China Mobile, China Telecom, Hytera Communications, Dahua Technology, Pacifica Networks/ComNet, and China Unicom (Americas).
- FCC Chair Brendan Carr noted that these companies may exploit regulatory loopholes to operate in the US.
- The investigation includes Letters of Inquiry and at least one subpoena to gather detailed activities of these firms.
- This action is part of a broader effort to secure US communications, following previous bans on Chinese firms providing telecom services due to security risks.

items.title: Italian newspaper launches AI-only journalism experiment
items.summary:
- Italian newspaper Il Foglio launched an experimental project called Foglio AI, using AI to write all content.
- The project is among the first of its kind for a national newspaper, exploring AI's potential in journalism.
- Foglio AI produces clear content but faces criticism for lacking investigative depth and emotional nuance.
- AI-generated articles are readable but struggle with subjective interpretations and direct source interactions.
- The initiative is intended to understand AI's capabilities, not to replace human journalists.

items.title: 7-Eleven operator reportedly selling US outlets
items.summary:
- Japanese retailer Seven & i Holdings is considering selling its US 7-Eleven outlets due to antitrust concerns related to takeover talks with Alimentation Couche-Tard.
- The company clarified that this consideration does not imply acceptance of Couche-Tard’s US$47 billion acquisition proposal.
- Seven & i stated that Couche-Tard must divest its US stores for the deal to move forward, and both companies have signed a confidentiality agreement to discuss potential buyers.

items.title: Ex-US prosecutor’s VC firm raises $1b for crypto investments
items.author: Katie Haun
items.summary:
- Haun Ventures is raising US$1 billion for two new funds, divided into US$500 million for early-stage and US$500 million for late-stage investments.
- The fundraising effort is expected to conclude in June 2025.
- The firm previously raised US$1.5 billion in 2022, led by founder Katie Haun, a former federal prosecutor known for blockchain investigations.
- Haun Ventures has invested in crypto infrastructure and stablecoin projects, backing companies like Bridge and BVNK.
- The firm is expected to be oversubscribed despite current market challenges, with nearly all initial funds deployed.
- Adaptations to the industry include hiring Anchorage cofounder Diogo Mónico as a general partner.

items.title: Perplexity plans US oversight for TikTok’s algorithm
items.summary:
- Perplexity AI proposes to restructure TikTok’s algorithm under US oversight to enhance transparency and user experience.
- The plan utilizes Nvidia Dynamo technology to improve TikTok's recommendation system, focusing on scalability and compliance with US privacy regulations.
- Features include context-driven capabilities for real-time information verification using AI and community input, shifting focus from engagement metrics to informational value.

items.title: China’s 01.AI shifts to DeepkSeek models, founder says
items.author: Lee Kai-fu
items.summary:
- Lee Kai-fu, founder of 01.AI, announces a shift towards DeepSeek's open-source models due to rising demand for AI solutions in China.
- Describes the current AI landscape in China as a “ChatGPT moment.”
- 01.AI, founded in mid-2023, initially focused on large language models but is now transitioning to a solutions provider.
- The company can customize DeepSeek’s models for specific business needs, differentiating it from competitors.
- DeepSeek's open-source model is gaining popularity among Chinese vendors, creating growth opportunities for 01.AI.

items.title: Fore Coffee brews $24m IPO despite market jitters
items.summary:
- Fore Coffee aims to raise 379.8 billion rupiah (US$24 million) through its IPO on April 11.
- The company plans to offer around 1.88 billion shares at a price range of 160 to 202 rupiah per share.
- 76% of IPO proceeds will be allocated to expanding its outlet network across Indonesia, targeting up to 600 locations in four years.
- The book-building period took place from March 19 to 21, with public offering from March 26 to April 9.
- Fore Coffee will be the first coffee chain in Indonesia to go public, competing with established brands like Kopi Kenangan and Toko Kopi Tuku.

items.title: PayU acquires 43.5% stake in Indian fintech firm Mindgate
items.summary:
- PayU, the fintech arm of Prosus, acquires a 43.5% stake in Mindgate Solutions, maintaining majority ownership for its founders.
- Mindgate specializes in real-time payments technology and supports India’s Unified Payments Interface (UPI), processing over 8 billion transactions monthly for banks.
- The investment enhances PayU’s position in India's digital payments sector and accelerates global expansion, leveraging Mindgate’s expertise as UPI transactions are projected to reach 100 billion monthly by 2030.
- Mindgate operates in regions including MENA, ASEAN, Europe, and the US, aiming to innovate real-time digital payments in collaboration with PayU.

items.title: Asia’s tech investors with the highest exit rates
items.summary:
- The article discusses tech investors in Asia with high exit rates, beneficial for startup founders seeking successful exits.
- Exits can occur through mergers, secondary sales, or public listings, though not all exits reflect true investor success.
- Later-stage investors typically show higher exit rates due to lower risk and increased liquidity.
- The data is incomplete, based on public sources, and readers are encouraged to report inaccuracies.

items.title: These are the most active investors in Japan’s startups
items.summary:
- The article discusses the most active investors in Japan's startups over the last 12 months.
- It presents a list of firms arranged by the number of deals made in that timeframe.
- Only firms that have invested in three or more companies in Japan within the past year are featured.
- The data is continually updated and welcomes corrections for inaccuracies.
- Premium subscription is required to access the full content.

items.title: ID tech firm partner, Nvidia’s program to launch AI accelerator
items.summary:
- Lintasarta launched the Semesta AI program in collaboration with Nvidia Inception to enhance Indonesia’s AI ecosystem.
- As the sole Nvidia Cloud Partner in Indonesia, they aim to expand access to AI technology.
- The program focuses on developing AI solutions tailored to local needs under AI Merdeka.
- Startups can receive technical guidance, Nvidia’s computing technology, and GPU vouchers of up to US$15,000 for top projects.
- Since its launch in November 2024, over 150 participants have applied, with the top 10 reaching the Black Belt stage.
- Selected startups will collaborate on AI solutions in various sectors including finance and healthcare.
- The initiative supports Indonesia’s Sustainable Development Goal 9 on industry, innovation, and infrastructure.

items.title: Meta tests AI-generated comment suggestions on Instagram
items.summary:
- Meta is testing an AI-powered comment suggestion feature on Instagram.
- The feature offers three AI-generated comment options based on the content of a photo.
- Users can access the suggestions by tapping a pencil icon next to the text input bar.
- Suggested comments are contextual; for example, smiling photos may get suggestions like "Cute living room setup."
- Meta has confirmed the feature is being trialed but has not provided a timeline for broad availability.
- Previous tests involved AI-generated comment summaries on Facebook, but it's uncertain if this feature will launch on Instagram.

items.title: Google tests news removal, claims little ad impact
items.author: A member of The Business Times.
items.summary:
- Google is testing the removal of news content from its platforms.
- The company asserts that this change has little impact on advertising revenue.
- The testing phase aims to evaluate user engagement and content monetization strategies.

items.title: Indian OTT platform Stage nets $12.5m series B
items.summary:
- Stage has raised US$12.5 million in its series B funding round.
- The funding was co-led by Goodwater Capital and Blume Ventures, with participation from various other investors.
- Stage aims to expand its content in three regional languages and explore new categories such as live sports and children's programming.
- The platform, founded in 2019, produces content in Haryanvi and Rajasthani languages.
- Stage reports 20 million users, including over 4.4 million paid subscribers, competing with other regional OTT platforms.

items.title: Snowflake, India’s FutureSkills to train 100k in AI, data
items.summary:
- Snowflake partners with FutureSkills Prime to train over 100,000 students and professionals in AI and data skills over the next two years.
- The training will include six free learning modules focused on data roles, with certifications from Nasscom and Snowflake.
- Courses align with the National Skills Qualification Framework and may be integrated into university curricula under the National Education Policy 2020.
- This initiative supports the Indian government's push for AI adoption and workforce upskilling, part of the IndiaAI Mission worth 10,300 crore rupees (approximately US$1.2 billion).

items.title: Google’s Gemini now offers AI-generated audio summaries
items.summary:
- Google has introduced a "Generate Audio Overview" feature in its Gemini app for creating audio summaries from detailed reports.
- This feature is available to both free users and Advanced subscribers, previously seen in NotebookLM since September 2024.
- Users can utilize Gemini’s Deep Research tool to generate reports and listen to summaries, enhancing accessibility and interactivity for research material.

items.title: Baidu stresses strict privacy rules after data leak incident
items.summary:
- Baidu denied allegations of breaching user privacy following a doxxing incident involving the daughter of VP Xie Guangjun.
- The company claims that the leaked data was from an overseas database with illegally acquired information, not its own systems.
- Baidu's security chief reinforced strict privacy protocols, including data anonymization and access controls.
- In response to criticism, Baidu announced a fund to combat cybercrime and plans to form an anti-doxxing alliance.
- The incident raises concerns about user privacy and potential risks to Baidu’s cloud storage and AI services.

items.title: Ticket resale firm StubHub files for New York IPO
items.summary:
- StubHub has filed for an IPO on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol “STUB”.
- The company reported a net loss of US$2.8 million on US$1.77 billion in revenue for 2024, contrasting with a US$405 million profit in 2023.
- Founded in 2000 and acquired by eBay in 2007, it was bought back by co-founder Eric Baker in 2020 for $US4 billion.
- In 2023, StubHub sold over 40 million tickets through about 1 million sellers.
- The IPO market has been sluggish but is recovering with recent filings from other companies.
- Citigroup and Wells Fargo are reportedly involved in StubHub’s public listing.

items.title: Tencent introduces large reasoning model Hunyuan-T1
items.summary:
- Tencent has launched its large reasoning model, Hunyuan-T1, which ranks highly in AI benchmarks.
- Hunyuan-T1 scored 87.2 on the MMLU-Pro dataset, ranking second to OpenAI's model.
- The model also performed well on benchmarks like CEval, AIME, and Zebra Logic, evaluating reasoning in Chinese and English.

items.title: UAE unveils $1.4t US investment in AI, semiconductors
items.summary:
- UAE announces a staggering $1.4 trillion investment in artificial intelligence and semiconductors.
- The investment aims to boost technological innovation and economic growth in the region.
- This initiative is seen as a key part of UAE's strategy to diversify its economy and reduce dependence on oil revenues.

items.title: AI robotics startup Bot Company raises $150m, sources say
items.author: Kyle Vogt, Paril Jain, Luke Holoubek
items.summary:
- The Bot Company raised $150 million in funding, led by Greenoaks, with a valuation of $2 billion.
- The company previously raised $150 million, reaching a $550 million valuation.
- The Bot Company focuses on developing non-humanoid AI-powered robots for household tasks.
- The robotics sector is experiencing strong VC interest, with $6.1 billion invested in 2023, a 19% increase from the previous year.
- Competitors include Tesla and Amazon in the household robotics market.

items.title: A list of fundraising startups from Asia and beyond (Updated)
items.summary:
- A curated list of fundraising startups for subscribers is offered.
- Startups can sign up for listing to attract investors through email notifications.
- Investors can receive curated listings of fundraising startups through subscription.
- The article suggests reaching out if a startup succeeds in fundraising for potential coverage.

items.title: Indonesian logistics firm J&T Cargo plans global expansion
Carsome achieved full-year profitability in 2024
items.summary:
- Malaysian used-car platform Carsome reported its first full-year profitability in 2024, with an adjusted EBITDA of US$10.5 million.
- This financial success was influenced by a 25% year-on-year increase in gross profit per unit.
- Contributing factors included higher margins on vehicle sales, increased revenue from platform services, and reduced refurbishment and logistics costs.

items.title: LG shuts down NFT platform as market volumes decline
items.summary:
- LG has closed its NFT platform, LG Art Lab, after three years of operation.
- The platform, launched in September 2022, will cease operations by June 17, and NFTs will be returned to user wallets by the end of April.
- The decision comes amid declining NFT market volumes, dropping below US$100 million from a peak of US$3.24 billion in August 2021.
- Other platforms like Kraken’s NFT marketplace and Nike's RTFKT have also shut down as interest in NFTs wanes.

items.title: Blockchain advocate Digital Chamber names new CEO
items.author: Not given
items.summary:
- Cody Carbone will become the new CEO of The Digital Chamber, replacing founder Perianne Boring who transitions to chair of the board in April.
- The organization will adopt a proactive approach to cryptocurrency regulations in the US, aligning with recent Trump administration initiatives.
- Carbone aims to focus on stablecoin legislation and market structure as the Senate Banking Committee advances the bipartisan GENIUS Act for regulatory framework clarification.

items.title: Xpeng launches first supercharger station in Hong Kong
items.summary:
- Xpeng has launched its first supercharger station in Hong Kong.
- The new station aims to enhance the availability of charging options for electric vehicles in the region.
- This move aligns with the growing demand for electric vehicles and infrastructure in urban areas.

items.title: Elon Musk urges Tesla staff to hold stock as shares drop
items.summary:
- On March 20, Elon Musk addressed Tesla employees as stock fell over 50% in three months, from $479.86 in December to $240.48 on March 21.
- Musk encouraged employees to retain their Tesla shares, referring to the current struggles as "stormy weather" and maintaining optimism about future developments.
- He mentioned Tesla's goal for full self-driving capabilities via a software update, plans for more affordable models by early 2025, and a pause in Model Y production for redesign.
- The meeting, notable for its length and Musk's direct communication style, also touched on the potential for electric aircraft development.
- Musk acknowledged current criticisms and challenges facing Tesla, including protests related to his political ties and vandalism at facilities.

items.title: TechCrunch Sold to Private Equity Firm Regent
items.summary:
- Tech news platform [TechCrunch](https://www.techinasia.com/news/news-platform-techcrunch-sold-to-private-equity-firm-regent) has been sold to private equity firm Regent.
- The acquisition marks a significant change in ownership for the platform.
- Details regarding the financial terms of the deal have not been disclosed.

items.title: These funds have not invested in China in the past year
items.summary:
- The article discusses funds that have previously invested in China but have not participated in funding rounds for tech startups in the last year.
- Reasons for this inactivity may include waiting for better conditions, shifting focus, or market conditions changing.
- The article emphasizes the importance of timing when reaching out to investors.

items.title: White House said to lead talks on TikTok’s US ownership shift
items.summary:
- The White House is discussing TikTok's future in the US with a focus on new ownership proposals.
- ByteDance's largest non-Chinese investors may take control of TikTok's American operations.
- The plan aims to reduce ByteDance's Chinese ownership below 20% to satisfy legal requirements and avoid a ban.
- Susquehanna International Group, General Atlantic, and KKR are involved in the discussions.
- Oracle will manage US user data to ensure protection from foreign access.
- TikTok faces scrutiny and must comply with laws demanding ownership changes due to national security concerns.
- ByteDance insists US data is stored on Oracle servers and that moderation is performed domestically.

items.title: Crypto market-making firm Gotbit CEO pleads guilty to fraud
items.summary:
- The CEO of Gotbit, a crypto market-making firm, has pleaded guilty to fraud.
- The plea was made in a federal court, indicating serious legal repercussions for the firm.
- This development may have significant implications for regulatory scrutiny in the crypto markets.

items.title: Micron shares fall 8% on margin forecast, AI demand still strong
items.summary:
- Micron shares fell 8% on Mar. 21 due to a lower-than-expected adjusted gross margin projection of 36.5%.  
- The projected margin fell short of analysts’ estimate of 36.9% despite a strong revenue outlook fueled by AI-related semiconductor demand.  
- Key factors affecting profitability included oversupply and declining prices for consumer memory chips, particularly in NAND Flash memory.  
- Micron has reduced production which contributes to margin pressure, but strong demand for high-bandwidth memory (HBM) from GPU makers like Nvidia is anticipated to drive growth.  
- Despite the drop, Micron shares are still up over 13% year-to-date, with investors optimistic about market conditions and Micron's role in the AI supply chain.

items.title: Meituan’s quarterly revenue jumps 20% to $12.2b
China issues new rules to regulate facial recognition
items.summary:
- China introduces new regulations for facial recognition technology starting June 1, 2025.
- Regulations aim to enhance data security and safeguard personal information against misuse of biometric data.
- Measures require clear, specific purposes for facial recognition and mandate informed consent, particularly for minors under 14.
- Prohibit use of facial recognition as the only identity verification method and ban installation in private areas of public venues.
- Organizations with data on over 100,000 individuals must file with cybersecurity authorities within 30 days.

items.title: First Hong Kong, now Southeast Asia
items.summary:
- WeLab Bank, based in Hong Kong, is expanding into Southeast Asia after achieving profitability, albeit later than some competitors.
- It has launched Bank Saqu in Indonesia and is seeking a license to operate in Thailand.
- WeLab Bank is partnering with major firms like Astra in Indonesia to replicate its success in the region.

items.title: These are the most active investors in India’s startups
items.summary:
- The article identifies the most active investors in India’s startups over the past 12 months.
- It features investors who have invested in three or more companies in India during this timeframe.
- The data is subject to updates and corrections, and readers are encouraged to report inaccuracies.

items.title: Japan’s Metaplanet appoints Eric Trump as advisor
items.summary:
- Metaplanet, Japan's large corporate bitcoin holder, has appointed Eric Trump to its Strategic Board of Advisors.
- The company currently holds 3,200 BTC and aims to increase reserves to 10,000 BTC by the end of 2025.
- CEO Simon Gerovich announced the appointment on March 21 via X.
- Eric Trump will aid in expanding bitcoin holdings and is involved in other cryptocurrency initiatives with his brothers.
- Following the news, Metaplanet's stock rose 1.3% to US$27.80 during trading in Japan.

items.title: Taiwan’s export orders surge 31% in Feb, driven by AI demand
items.summary:
- Taiwan’s export orders rose by 31% year-on-year in February, totaling US$49.45 billion.
- Key drivers included strong demand for AI and high-performance computing chips, and new smartphone launches.
- The figure surpassed estimates of US$43.5 billion to US$45.5 billion.
- March projections suggest a 10.3% to 14.5% growth, potentially reaching US$52 billion to US$54 billion.
- First-quarter export orders expected to increase by 11.3% to 12.8%, totaling US$148.4 billion to US$150.4 billion.
- Non-technology sectors struggled with price competition; base metals orders fell by 10.7%.

items.title: Apple supplier Wingtech sells $635m assets after US sanction
Indian B2B travel tech firm investors to sell 3.1% stake
Zomato rebrands to Eternal Limited
